sources.data_found: Lists VACC resources including DeepGreen (massively parallel) and Bluemoon (shared memory/general purpose).
2022 Degree Completion Data: Computer Science Bachelors (117), Master's (16), Research Doctorate (2).

student_data.notes: Exact current enrollment by department is not publicly broken down on the UVM Registrar site (only College-level data is available). Counts are estimated based on DataUSA/IPEDS 2022 degree completion data. Undergrad estimated as Degrees Awarded (117) × 4 years = 468. Masters estimated as Degrees Awarded (16) × 2 years = 32. PhD estimated as Degrees Awarded (2) × 6 years residence = 12.

gpu_resources.notes: Primary GPU resource is the 'DeepGreen' cluster. Specs verified via official CEMS page: 80 nodes × 2 NVIDIA Tesla V100 GPUs per node = 160 V100s. While the general purpose cluster 'Bluemoon' mentions having GPU nodes in documentation, specific counts and models are not publicly enumerated in open web specifications, so only the verifiable DeepGreen inventory is included. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

analysis_notes: UVM's primary AI/HPC resource is the DeepGreen cluster, funded by NSF (MRI) and launched around 2019/2020. It features a homogeneous architecture of V100 GPUs. Student data is derived from federal completion statistics (IPEDS/DataUSA) due to the lack of granular departmental enrollment reports on the university website.
